----------

ContainedObjects.Description:
Enduring Strength
----------
Once per battle, you may spend 1 [b]energy[/b] to choose 1 card from any Ranger's discard pile and place it on the bottom of their deck.

Impulsive
----------
You may spend 1 [b]energy[/b] to take the first turn in the battle even if there is an enemy card with the [b]FAST[/b] keyword in play.

Steadfast
----------
Each time you suffer damage, before revealing any cards for defense, you may choose 1 card from your hand and place it on top of your deck.

Technician
----------
Once per battle, a Ranger of your choice may place up to 3 cards from their hand on the bottom of their deck, then draw an equal number of cards.

Cry Havoc
----------
If there are 3 or more enemy figures in your location, reduce the energy cost of all of your cards by 1.

Determination
----------
Once per battle, you may either discard 1 card to gain 1 [b]energy[/b] or spend 1 [b]energy[/b] to draw 1 card.

A Light in the Darkness
----------
Once per battle, when you add [b]energy[/b] from your personal storage to the shared energy pool, gain 1 [b]energy[/b].

Eye Of The Tiger
----------
Once per battle, during any Ranger turn, you may use this ability instead of playing a card. Perform an attack with a number of dice equal to the number of chromafury ([b]Chromafury[/b]) icons in your hand. Then shuffle your hand into your deck and draw 2 cards.

Mr. Fantastic Super Handsome Strong As Steel
----------
Once per battle, when you would draw a card, you may instead discard the top card of your deck. If you do, add 2 dice to the next attack any Ranger performs during this battle.

Prodigy
----------
Once per battle, up to 2 different Rangers may each look at the top card of their deck and then may each draw 1 card. You may use this ability during battles in other locations.

Problem Solver
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger draws a card after the Preparation Step, gain 1 [b]energy[/b].

Grid Battleforce Training
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger reveals a card for defense, if that card has a [b]★[/b] ability, that ability resolves twice.

Quick Wits
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger suffers damage, you may draw 1 card. If you do, reduce that damage by the number of [b]shields[/b] on that card.

Dark Pride
----------
When you would play a card from your hand, you may play the top card of your discard pile instead. If you do, you must then discard the top card of your deck.

Dig Deeper
----------
Once per battle, any Ranger may search their deck for 1 card of their choice, then shuffle their deck and place that card on top of their deck.

It's About To Get Wild!
----------
Once per battle, at the start of any Ranger turn, any Ranger may draw 2 cards. If they do, add 2 dice to the next attack that Ranger performs during that turn.

Rhythm Star
----------
Once per battle, after any Ranger resolves an attack or maneuver card, another Ranger may immediately play 1 card with an energy cost exactly 1 [b]energy[/b] higher.

Key Of Sixth Rangers
----------
Construct your key deck with Rangers who are not core team members. Once per Ranger turn in battle, you may discard 1 card from your hand to draw 1 card from your key deck.

True Focus
----------
At the end of each battle, add 1 [b]energy[/b] to your personal storage (if you do not have 1 already).

Mission Control
----------
While your figure is in the Command Center, you may participate in battles taking place in outer locations. If you do, you are not considered to be in the battle for the purposes of enemy card effects.

Defiant Defense
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger reveals a card for defense, you may choose 1 card from your hand and remove it from the game. If you do, add 5 [b]shields[/b] to the revealed card.

Erratic Teleportation
----------
At any time, you may discard 1 card from your hand to move your figure to an outer location of your choice. (You may use this ability in battles you are not participating in.)

Energy Burst
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger spends at least 3 [b]energy[/b] to play a card, you may deal 1 [b]¤[/b] to an enemy card of your choice.

Time Burst
----------
Once per battle, after any Ranger turn in battle when the Rangers played exactly 1 card, they may take an additional turn. During that turn, Rangers may only play maneuver cards.

Assault Burst
----------
Once per battle, before rolling dice for an attack, you may add 3 dice to that attack. Skip the next Ranger turn in battle.

Ferocity
----------
Once per Ranger turn, instead of playing a card, you may discard 1 card from your hand to perform an attack with 2 dice.

Unorthodox Master
----------
Once per battle, after any Ranger performs a maneuver or reaction, gain 1 [b]energy[/b].

Mercurial Force
----------
Once per battle, before any Ranger rolls any number of dice, you may use this ability. If you do, convert all [b]○[/b] results rolled to [b]¤¤[/b] results and vice versa.

For Honor
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger reveals a card for defense with no [b]★[/b] ability, you may reveal a card from your hand and use its [b]★[/b] ability as though it were revealed for defense.

Reserved Strength
----------
Once per battle, during any Ranger attack, you may convert 1 [b]¤[/b] or [b]¤¤[/b] result to a [b]○[/b] result. If you do, gain 2 [b]energy[/b].

Squad Commander
----------
Once per battle, during any Ranger turn, you may spend 1 [b]energy[/b] to allow another Ranger to perform an attack with 3 dice instead of playing a card.

Transmutation
----------
Once per battle, after any Ranger rolls at least 1 [b]○[/b] result during an attack, you may spend 1 [b]energy[/b] and remove a different die from that attack to convert the [b]○[/b] result to a [b]¤¤[/b] result.

Replication
----------
Once per battle, after any Ranger rolls dice for an attack, you may spend 1 [b]energy[/b] to choose 1 die result and add 1 die to the attack with the same result.

Psychometry
----------
Once per battle, you may spend 1 [b]energy[/b] to reduce the energy cost of the next card any Ranger plays by 2.

Barrier Field
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger suffers damage, you may spend 1 [b]energy[/b] to reduce that damage by 2.

Phantom Leader
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger resolves an attack card with an energy cost of zero, you may spend 1 [b]energy[/b] to immediately play 1 card with an energy cost of zero.

Fierce Impact
----------
Once per battle, after you resolve an attack, if the attack dealt at least 3 [b]¤[/b], deal 1 [b]¤[/b] to an enemy card adjacent to the target.

Legendary Mentor
----------
Once per battle, before a Ranger performs an attack, you may add 1 die to that attack.

Perfect Pitch
----------
Once per attack, when you roll a [b]¤¤[/b] result, gain 1 [b]energy[/b].

Clever Solution
----------
Once per attack, when you roll a [b]○[/b] result, any Ranger may draw 1 card.

Swift Striker
----------
If there is an enemy card in play with the [b]FAST[/b] keyword, you may take the first turn of the battle. If you do, remove 1 die before rolling from the first attack you perform during this battle.

Super Samurai Mode
----------
At the start of each battle, if Samurai Shield is not in your hand, you [b]must[/b] search your deck and discard pile for that card and swap it with a card from your hand. If you searched your deck, shuffle it.

Crashing Thunder
----------
Once per battle, after any Ranger attacks an enemy card with the [b]GUARD[/b] keyword, you may deal 1 [b]¤[/b] to an enemy card adjacent to the target.

Roaring Thunder
----------
Once per battle, after any Ranger attacks an enemy card  without the [b]GUARD[/b] keyword, gain 1 [b]energy[/b].

Lone Wolf
----------
During each battle, until another Ranger's card is played, reduce the energy cost of all Lunar Wolf Ranger cards by 1.

Quantum Power
----------
At the start of each battle, roll 2 dice and place 1 of them on this card. This is your quantum die. Once during each of your attacks, you may swap 1 die from the attack with your quantum die. The swapped die becomes your new quantum die.

Contingency
----------
At the start of each battle, you may choose 2 enemy cards of the same type ([b]Foot Soldier[/b], [b]Monster[/b], [b]Boss[/b]) and swap their positions in the combat sequence.

Heavy Force
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger gains [b]energy[/b], you may reduce the amount gained by up to 2 [b]energy[/b], then deal an equal amount of [b]¤[/b] to an enemy card of your choice.

Future Vision
----------
Once per battle, you may look at the top card of any enemy deck. You may swap that card with a non-[b]PASSIVE[/b] enemy card from the same deck that has not yet resolved in the combat sequence. Then shuffle that enemy deck.

Flexibility
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger reveals a card for defense, you may choose a card in your hand. Treat the revealed card as having the shield value of the chosen card.

Willful Strength
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger plays an attack card, you may reveal an attack card with the same energy cost from your hand. Treat the played card as having the attack value of the revealed card (if neither attack value is special).

Unbreakable
----------
Once per battle, if your deck is reduced to zero cards, you are not defeated. Instead, recover cards from your discard pile with a total of up to 3 [b]shields[/b].

Avenging Knight
----------
Once per battle, after an enemy card deals damage to you, deal 1 [b]¤[/b] to that enemy card.

Old Wounds
----------
Once per battle, if there are 2 cards with the same name in your discard pile, you may add 1 of them to your hand.

Know Your Enemy
----------
Once per battle, during any Ranger attack, if an effect allows the [b]GUARD[/b] keyword to be ignored, you may gain 1 [b]energy[/b] or deal 1 [b]¤[/b] to an enemy card of your choice.

Silver Charm
----------
Once per battle, when you gain any amount of [b]energy[/b], increase that amount by 1.

Ready to Rock
----------
Once per battle, any Ranger may discard the top card of their deck, then choose 1 card from their discard pile and place it on top of their deck.

Optimism
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger rolls any [b]○[/b] results during an attack, gain 1 [b]energy[/b].

Level Headed
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger performs an attack, they may remove up to 2 dice before rolling to add that much [b]¤[/b] to that attack.

Hot Blooded
----------
Once per attack, if you have 2 or fewer cards in your hand, you may reroll any number of dice during that attack.

Covert Tactics
----------
Once per battle, any Ranger may ignore the [b]GUARD[/b] keyword when choosing a target for an attack.

Cloaking Device
----------
When you perform a [b]MOVE[/b] action, you may move your figure to or from this card. During any battle, if your figure is on this card, you may move it to that location to join the battle.

Agent Of The Grid
----------
Once per battle, you may flip 1 unused action token to move your figure to this card and recover up to 6 [b]shields[/b]. Return your figure to that location at the start of any Ranger turn or at the end of the battle.

In The Name Of The Law
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger plays an attack card, if that card's effect text refers to a keyword ([b]FAST[/b], [b]GUARD[/b], [b]PASSIVE[/b]), gain 1 [b]energy[/b].

Shift Into Turbo
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger plays a card with an energy cost of X, they may resolve it as though they spent +1 [b]energy[/b].

Heart of Gold
----------
Each time you play a card, in addition to its normal effects, you may reveal 1 card from your hand and resolve the [GOLD] ability on the revealed card. If you do, place the revealed card on the bottom of your deck and draw 1 card.

Power of Triforia
----------
Each time you play a card, in addition to its normal effects, resolve the [GOLD] ability on that card. You may spend 1 [b]energy[/b] to resolve that ability a second time.

Shining Star
----------
Once per battle, you may reveal 1 card from your hand and use the [b]★[/b] ability on that card as if it were revealed for defense.

Vanguard
----------
Each time an enemy card deals damage to you, gain 1 hit token and place it on this card (max. 3). You may spend hit tokens from this card to trigger special abilities on your combat cards.

Called Shot
----------
At the start of each battle, you may attach 1 energy token to an enemy card of your choice. When an enemy card is defeated, move all attached energy tokens from that card to the shared pool.

Critical Strike
----------
Once during each of your attacks, if you roll any [b]¤¤[/b] die results, add 1 [b]¤[/b] to that attack.

One Step Ahead
----------
You may look at the top card of your deck at any time. You may play that card as though it were in your hand.

Honor Of Aquitar
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger rolls a [b]○[/b] result during an attack, deal 1 [b]¤[/b] to an enemy card of your choice.

Omega Earth Power
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger plays an attack card, they may discard another card with the same name from their hand. If they do, add 2 dice to that attack.

Omega Air Power
----------
Once per battle, at the start of any Ranger turn, you may remove 1 hit token from an enemy card of your choice. If you do, place 1 hit token each on up to 2 other enemy cards.

Omega Fire Power
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger performs an attack, you may remove all [b]○[/b] results from that attack. If you do so, the next time any Ranger performs an attack in this battle, add that many dice to that attack.

Bag of Gifts
----------
At the start of each battle, you may give 1 card from your hand to another Ranger as a gift. When another Ranger plays a card, they may reveal 1 gift, resolve its [b]GIFT[/b] effect, and then place it in your discard pile.

Noble Pursuit
----------
Once per battle, you may place up to 2 dice on this card (max 2). Each time you perform an attack during this battle, you may remove 1 die from this card to add 1 die to that attack.

Black Dragon
----------
At the start of each battle, place the Dragon Claw token on an enemy card of your choice. Rangers may ignore the [b]GUARD[/b] keyword when attacking that card until the end of the battle.

Finishing Shot
----------
After the last enemy card in the combat sequence resolves, deal 1 [b]¤[/b] to an enemy card of your choice.

Big Bully
----------
Once per battle, you may verbally insult 1 enemy card, then discard 1 card from your hand to deal 1 [b]¤[/b] to that enemy card.

Wingman

The Power of Ninja!
----------
Once per battle, each Ranger may look at the bottom card of their deck and may swap that card with a card from their hand.

Agile
----------
When you suffer damage, before revealing a card for defense, you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.

Momentum
----------
Once per battle, after you defeat an enemy card with an attack, gain 1 [b]energy[/b].

----------
Once per battle, you may swap a card from your hand with the top card of your discard pile.

Bravery
----------
When you reveal a card for defense, if that card would be placed on the bottom of your deck, you may add it to your hand instead.

Rallying Light
----------
Once per battle, if the shared energy pool is empty, you can add 1 [b]energy[/b] to it.

Live Fearlessly
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger plays the last card from their hand, you may reduce its energy cost to zero.

Guardian Light
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger reveals a card for defense, you may add 1 [b]shield[/b] to that card.

Guardian Light
----------
Once per battle, when any Ranger reveals a card for defense, you may add 1 [b]shield[/b] to that card.

ContainedObjects.Nickname: Mighty Morphin Red I (Dragon Shield) (Jason Lee Scott)
ContainedObjects.Description:
Legacy of the Dragon

During setup, add the Dragon Shield (Mighty Morphin Red) and Dragon Dagger (Mighty Morphin Red) cards to your starting hand.

Gift of the Dragon

Once per battle, you may choose one card in your hand and place it on any other Ranger's character card. That Ranger may then play that card as though it was in their hand. After being played, it goes to the bottom of your deck.

Legends Never Die
----------
When you discard a card for defense, another Ranger may add that card to their hand. For each Ranger with at least 1 of your cards in their hand, add 1 die to each of your attacks. Return those cards to your discard pile when played or when the battle ends.

Loner
----------
If you are the only player with a Ranger in your location, you may add 1 die to each of your attacks.

Loner
----------
If you are the only player with a Ranger in your location, you may add 1 die to each of your attacks.

ContainedObjects.Description:
It's Morphin Time

At the start of each battle, you may initiate a morphing call. If each Ranger in the battle shouts their morphing call, without interrupting each other, the Rangers may ignore the [b]FAST[/b] and [b]GUARD[/b] keywords until the end of the first Ranger turn.

ContainedObjects.Nickname: Mighty Morphin Red I (Jason Lee Scott [Vintage])
ContainedObjects.Description:
Leadership

Once per battle, a Ranger of your choice may reroll any number of dice during an attack.

Once per battle, a Ranger of your choice may reroll any number of dice during an attack.

Once per battle, after you play a card, you may immediately play another card with the same name.

Strategize

Once per battle, a Ranger of your choice may draw 1 card and then place 1 card from their hand back on top of their deck.

Strategize

ContainedObjects.Description:

----------
Once per battle, you may attempt to stack up to 6 dice within 7 seconds using one hand. After you finish, wait 3 seconds, then gain 1 [b]energy[/b] for every 2 dice in the stack.

At the start of each battle, you may deal 1 [b]¤[/b] to an enemy card of your choice.

At the start of each battle, you may deal 1 [b]¤[/b] to an enemy card of your choice.

Time for my Slamma-Jamma, Double-Whamma, Hip-Hoppit, 'Cause-Ya-Can't-Stop-It, Big-Disgrace, 'Cause-It's-In-Your-Face, Long Shot!

Once per battle, you may say the name of this ability, then toss a hit token onto the table from at least 3 feet away. If it lands in an outer location, deal 2 [b]¤[/b] to an enemy card of your choice. If it lands in the Command Center, deal 3 [b]¤[/b] instead.

Mission Control
----------
While your figure is in the Command Center, you may participate in battles taking place in outer locations. If you do, you are not considered to be in the battle for the purposes of enemy card effects.

When any Ranger performs the [b]RECOVER[/b] action, they may choose to recover up to 2 fewer [b]shields[/b] in order to draw an equal number of cards from the Alpha 5 I deck. When any Ranger plays an Alpha 5 I card, shuffle it back into the Alpha 5 I deck.

Aye-yi-yi!

You cannot move from the Command Center. You cannot perform the [b]BATTLE[/b] action, but you may play cards in every battle, regardless of location. When you perform the [b]RECOVER[/b] action, you may allow another Ranger to recover instead.

When you move to the Command Center, you may [b]POWER UP[/b].

To [b]POWER UP[/b], shuffle all cards from your hand and discard pile back into your deck, then draw a new hand of up to 5 cards. In addition, take 1 energy token (per Ranger you control) from the supply (if you do not have 1 per Ranger you control already).

[b]POWERING UP[/b] is a free action and does not count against your available actions.

When you move to the Astro Megaship, you may immediately perform a free [b]RECOVER[/b] action, without flipping an action token.

When you perform the [b]RECOVER[/b] action at the Astro Megaship, you may [b]STRATEGIZE[/b]: Choose one Ranger in any location. That Ranger may draw up to three cards, then choose an equal number of cards from their hand and place them on top of their deck.
At the start of each Action Phase, each Ranger at the Time Force HQ may immediately [b]TRANSWARP[/b]. This allows them to move to another location of their choice without spending an action.

During setup, place two action tokens on Jungle Karma Pizza, in addition to any action tokens gained when playing with fewer than five Rangers.

Any Ranger may flip an action token on Jungle Karma Pizza face down to perform a [b]RECOVER[/b] action. During this action, they may recover +1 total shield value of combat cards from their discard pile. At the end of the Action Phase, flip all action tokens face up.

When you move to the Grid Battleforce HQ, you may immediately perform a free [b]RECOVER[/b] action, without flipping an action token.

Once per battle, any Ranger at the Grid Battleforce HQ may perform a [b]weapon transport[/b] by revealing their hand. Any other Ranger in the battle may discard one card from their hand to play one of the revealed cards as though it were in their hand. If they do, the played card is then shuffled back into its owner's deck.
At the start of each battle, Void Knight deals an amount of damage equal to the total number of Zord and arsenal cards in play.
The Ranger with the most cards in their hand cannot play combat cards until at least 1 Vrak card is defeated in this battle.

Primator

Rat tokens follow the same rules as Foot Soldiers for deployment, location figure limits, and battling, except that if they would be deployed to a location at its figure limit they replace an existing Foot Soldier of the Rangers’ choice in that location instead of moving one location clockwise.

When battling in locations containing one or more Rat Token, those tokens must be battled first until they are defeated (for example, if there are three or more other Foot Soldiers and two Rat Tokens, only two other Foot Soldiers may be in each battle until the Rat Tokens are defeated), draw cards from Primator’s combat deck into the Foot Soldier row.

During setup, place this token in the HQ space. At any time, the Rangers may choose to exhaust any Zord card to move the Auric The Conqueror token to any outer location.

During each battle in the location containing the Auric The Conqueror token, instead of taking a turn, any Ranger may spend 1 [b]energy[/b] and discard 1 card from their hand to deal 1 [b]¤[/b] each to a number of adjacent enemy cards equal to twice the number of the current round (2 cards on Round 1, 4 on Round 2, and so on). This damage is treated as though it came from a Reaction or Zord card (i.e. it is not impeded by [b]GUARD[/b] or most other similar effects).

At the end of each battle this ability is used in, move the Auric The Conqueror token to the HQ space.

During the Deployment Phase of the first round, place this token in the location of the first deployment. Lokar does not count against location figure limits, but as long as he is present in a location, Panic Tokens cannot be removed from that location. At the beginning of each Deployment Phase move this token counter-clockwise by one location.

At the end of each Deployment Phase add a Panic Token to the location containing this token if there is not one there already.

During all battles in the location containing this token, the first enemy card defeated is immediately turned face-up again, with any Foot Soldiers that would be removed staying in place.

When Cyclopsis’ deployment card is drawn, place this token in that location. Lokar does not count against location figure limits and is not removed by Cyclopsis’ deployment effect as would happen with Foot Soldiers.

During all battles in the location containing the Lokar token, the first Cyclopsis Component card defeated is immediately turned face-up again, removing all damage counters.

If that card is the Core of Cyclopsis, its damage effect is activated and resolved as normal before it is turned face-up again. If that card is the Left Arm of Cyclopsis and any other Component card(s) have only 1 HP remaining, the other card(s) are defeated and flipped over while the Left Arm is face-down; Lokar’s effect then is activated and turns only the Left Arm face-up again as normal, leaving any other cards defeated by the momentary absence of the Left Arm’s effect in their face-down position.

During the Deployment Phase of the first round, place this token in the location of the first deployment. Lokar does not count against location figure limits, but as long as he is present in a location, Panic Tokens cannot be removed from that location. At the beginning of each Deployment Phase move this token counter-clockwise by one location.

At the end of each Deployment Phase add a Panic Token to the location containing this token if there is not one there already.

During all battles in the location containing this token, the first enemy card defeated is immediately turned face-up again, with any Foot Soldiers that would be removed staying in place.
A homebrew campaign following canonical Power Rangers stories from the TV shows and Boom! Studios comics.

Description:
Mighty Morphin Power Rangers
----------
Exhaust this card to place the Megazord token in any location. At the start of each battle in the Megazord's current location, deal 1 [b]¤[/b] to each enemy card.

Mighty Morphin Power Rangers
----------
Exhaust this card to place the Megazord token in any location. At the start of each battle in the Megazord's current location, deal 6 dice of [b]¤[/b] to one enemy card.

Mighty Morphin Power Rangers
----------
Once per Ranger turn in battle, any Ranger may exhaust 1 Zord card to deal 3 [b]¤[/b] to an enemy card that has resolved.

Mighty Morphin Power Rangers
----------
Each time any Ranger performs an attack, they may reroll any number of dice.

Mighty Morphin Power Rangers
----------
Exhaust this card to place the Megazord token in any location. At the end of each battle in that location, roll 5 dice. Deal that much [b]¤[/b], divided as you choose among enemy cards.

Mighty Morphin Power Rangers
----------
When this card is summoned and at the start of each Action Phase, add 2 energy tokens to this card (max 2). Once per battle, after any Ranger turn, the Rangers may remove 1 token from this card to immediately take another turn.

Mighty Morphin Power Rangers
----------
Exhaust this card after any Ranger resolves a card. That Ranger may immediately play that card a second time, ignoring its energy cost. If its energy cost is zero, they may immediately play it a third time.

Mighty Morphin Power Rangers
----------
Exhaust this card when any enemy card deals damage to a Ranger. Prevent all of that damage and deal an equal amount of [b]¤[/b] to that enemy card.

Mighty Morphin Power Rangers
----------
Exhaust this card at the start of any Ranger turn in battle. Deal 2 [b]¤[/b] to each enemy card.

Power Rangers Zeo
----------
Exhaust this card to place the Megazord token in any location. During each battle in the Megazord's current location, reduce the energy cost of all cards by 1.

Power Rangers Zeo
----------
At the start of each battle, add 2 energy tokens to this card (max 2). When any Ranger performs an attack, they may remove 1 energy token from this card to add 3 dice to that attack.

Power Rangers Zeo
----------
Exhaust this card at the start of a battle. Each time a Ranger performs an attack during that battle, they may divide the [b]¤[/b] from that attack among any number of targets.

Power Rangers In Space
----------
When you summon this card, and at the start of each Action Phase, place 5 energy tokens on this card (max 5). Each time a Ranger suffers damage, you may remove 1 energy token to reduce that damage by 3.

Lost Galaxy Rangers
----------
At the start of each battle, add 5 energy tokens to this card (max 5). When any Ranger performs an attack, they may spend up to 2 energy tokens from this card to reduce that attack's energy cost by an equal amount.

Power Rangers Lightspeed Rescue
----------
When any Ranger reveals a card with exactly 1 [b]shield[/b] for defense, that Ranger may either deal 1 [b]¤[/b] to an enemy card of their choice or add +1 [b]shield[/b] to that card.

Power Rangers Time Force
----------
Exhaust this card to place the Megazord token in any location. At the start of each battle in that location, choose the [b]FAST[/b] or [b]GUARD[/b] keyword. Rangers may ignore the chosen keyword until the end of the battle.

Power Rangers Wild Force
----------
Once per turn, when any Ranger reveals a card for defense, they may choose to gain 1 [b]energy[/b], deal 1 [b]¤[/b] to an enemy card of their choice, or add 1 [b]shield[/b] to the revealed card.

Power Rangers Ninja Storm
----------
While this card is in play, the health value of all enemy cards is reduced by 1.

Power Rangers Dino Thunder
----------
When this card is summoned and at the start of each round, add 4 energy tokens to this card (max 4). Once per Ranger turn in battle, any Ranger may remove 1 energy token from this card to ready an exhausted Zord card.

Power Rangers S.P.D.
----------
Once per battle, when an enemy card is defeated, place their deployment card here until the end of the battle. Each time a Ranger performs an attack that targets them during the battle, that Ranger may gain 1 [b]energy[/b] or reroll any number of dice.

Power Rangers S.P.D.
----------
During each battle, when a foot soldier card is defeated, deal 2 [b]¤[/b] to another enemy card.

Power Rangers S.P.D.
----------
Exhaust this card to place the Megazord token in any location. When any Ranger moves to that location or performs the [b]RECOVER[/b] action in that location, they may power up.

Power Rangers Operation Overdrive
----------
Exhaust this card at any time to place the Megazord token in any location. Each time a Ranger in that location rolls at least 1 [b]¤¤[/b] result, that Ranger may return 1 card from their discard pile to the bottom of their deck.

Power Rangers RPM
----------
Exhaust this card at the end of any Ranger turn in battle. Gain 2 [b]energy[/b]. The Rangers may take an additional turn after this one. The next time any Ranger performs an attack during this battle, add 2 dice to that attack.

Power Rangers RPM
----------
Place 3 energy tokens on this card at the start of each battle (max 3). After any Ranger plays a card, they may remove 1 energy token from this card to place the played card on the bottom of their deck instead of discarding it and draw 1 card.

Power Rangers Ninja Steel
----------
While this card is in play, each time a Ranger plays a card with an energy cost of zero, gain 1 [b]energy[/b].

Dino Charge Rangers
----------
At the start of each Ranger turn, any Ranger may draw 1 card from the bottom of their deck. Once per turn, when any Ranger draws 1 or more cards, they may deal 1 [b]¤[/b] to an enemy card of their choice.

Beast Morphers Rangers
----------
At the start of each battle, place 3 energy tokens on this card (max 3). Any Ranger may remove 1 energy token from this card to play 1 card from their discard pile as though it were in their hand. If they do, reduce its energy cost by 1.

Power Rangers Beast Morphers
----------
Exhaust this card after any Ranger resolves a card with an energy cost of X. Return all [b]energy[/b] spent to play that card to the shared energy pool.

Solar Rangers
----------
Exhaust this card during a battle. Gain 7 [b]energy[/b].

HyperForce
----------
At the start of each battle, each participating Ranger may search their deck or discard pile for a card and add it to their hand. If they do, they must shuffle their deck.

When you move to the Command Center, you may [b]POWER UP[/b].

To [b]POWER UP[/b], shuffle all cards from your hand and discard pile back into your deck, then draw a new hand of up to 5 cards. In addition, take 1 energy token (per Ranger you control) from the supply (if you do not have 1 per Ranger you control already).

[b]POWERING UP[/b] is a free action and does not count against your available actions.

When you move to the Astro Megaship, you may immediately perform a free [b]RECOVER[/b] action, without flipping an action token.

When you perform the [b]RECOVER[/b] action at the Astro Megaship, you may [b]STRATEGIZE[/b]: Choose one Ranger in any location. That Ranger may draw up to three cards, then choose an equal number of cards from their hand and place them on top of their deck.
At the start of each Action Phase, each Ranger at the Time Force HQ may immediately [b]TRANSWARP[/b]. This allows them to move to another location of their choice without spending an action.

During setup, place two action tokens on Jungle Karma Pizza, in addition to any action tokens gained when playing with fewer than five Rangers.

Any Ranger may flip an action token on Jungle Karma Pizza face down to perform a [b]RECOVER[/b] action. During this action, they may recover +1 total shield value of combat cards from their discard pile. At the end of the Action Phase, flip all action tokens face up.

When you move to the Grid Battleforce HQ, you may immediately perform a free [b]RECOVER[/b] action, without flipping an action token.

Once per battle, any Ranger at the Grid Battleforce HQ may perform a [b]weapon transport[/b] by revealing their hand. Any other Ranger in the battle may discard one card from their hand to play one of the revealed cards as though it were in their hand. If they do, the played card is then shuffled back into its owner's deck.
